so far from a pure UX/UI perspective, my experience on SOL w/ NFTs & defi has been great. SOL currently lacks the # of projects & liquidity depth. But devs are coming, and some great ones there already (happy member of @Grim__Syndicate, top notch content+community execution)

Learning by doing in defi on @solana this morning. The @phantom wallet is great, recognizing my tokens immediately w/ a better UI (icon/logos), & the defi apps were polished (@InvictusDAO @JupiterExchange) with UI features not yet on similar ETH apps. Very fast & minuscule gas.

Another one. Fake accounts on Twitter (web2) used to market ‚ÄúFree Cash‚Äù on the Cash App (web2), one of the largest p2p payment platforms. Don‚Äôt throw stones‚Ä¶ I think fair debate starts with not holding either current or new technologies to unreasonable purity tests https://t.co/aIoe5Vmagp

And strong community mixed with culture. People like to be part of a tribe, and also sure, free stuff too. But has to start with UX, community first to work well.

critics discount web3 ‚Äútokenomics‚Äù as steroids to acquire users vs purist UX/utility alone, but p2e as a complement is as old as radio (who still does it daily) or as new as an extra gig from Invite Friends flows or free cash w/ CashApp & Travis Scott. https://t.co/yOp2B9AiS6 https://t.co/7eaQsDZLeI

Centralization/decentralization is one part of web3. Promise also includes internet-scale auth, micropayment, and identity. All for the same goal‚Äî> 10x convenience and usability. We aren‚Äôt there yet, but when we are will change how we use & build web apps https://t.co/KWt19jD5AN
